Class StereochemistryTool

java.lang.Object
  org.xmlcml.cml.tools.AbstractTool
      org.xmlcml.cml.tools.StereochemistryTool
All Implemented Interfaces:
CMLConstants, EuclidConstants
public class StereochemistryTool
extends AbstractTool

tool to manage stereochemistry. not yet fully developed

Author:
pmr

Method Detail

add2DStereo

public void add2DStereo()
                 throws CMLException
uses 2D coordinates to add bondStereo.

Throws:
CMLException - inappropriate connectivity, coordinates, etc.

addWedgeHatch

public void addWedgeHatch()
                   throws CMLException
uses atomParity to add wedge and hatch.

Throws:
CMLException

addWedgeHatchBonds

public void addWedgeHatchBonds()
                        throws CMLRuntimeException
add wedge hatch bonds. adds WEDGE/HATCH to appropriate bonds/atoms if not already present and we have parities. If ANY wedge/hatch are set, return without action (this may change)

Throws:
CMLRuntimeException

calculateAtomParity

public CMLAtomParity calculateAtomParity(CMLAtom atom)
Calculates the atom parity of this atom using the coords of either 4 explicit ligands or 3 ligands and this atom. If only 2D coords are specified then the parity is calculated using bond wedge/hatch information.

Parameters:
atom -
Returns:
the CMLAtomParity, or null if this atom isnt a chiral centre or there isnt enough stereo information to calculate parity

isChiralCentre

public boolean isChiralCentre(CMLAtom atom)
Determines whether this atom is a chiral centre, currently only works for carbon atoms with 4 ligands (or 3 + an implicit hydrogen).

Parameters:
atom -
Returns:
true unless this atom has 2 or more identical ligands

getChiralAtoms

public java.util.List<CMLAtom> getChiralAtoms()
gets list of atoms with enough different ligands to show chirality. at present only processes Carbon. all four ligands must be different or either explicitly or with an implicit hydrogen and 3 explict ligands the atom may or may not have its chirality set by other means (e.g. atomParity) however an atom may not be tested for chirality if it is not in this list

Returns:
the list of atoms

get2DBondStereo

public CMLBondStereo get2DBondStereo(CMLBond bond)
                              throws CMLException
get the bondstereo from 2D coordinates. gets atomRefs4 (at0, at1, at2, at3), then gets scalar product of at1-at0 X at1-lig2 and at1-at2 X at1-lig2 does NOT add bondStereo as child (in case further decisions need to be made)

Parameters:
bond -
Returns:
bondstereo (null if cannot calculate as CIS/TRANS)
Throws:
CMLException

layoutDoubleBond

public void layoutDoubleBond(CMLBond bond)
                      throws CMLException
uses bondStereo to adjust 2D coordinates.

Parameters:
bond -
Throws:
CMLException

flip2D

public void flip2D(CMLBond bond)
            throws CMLException
flip (about bond axis) the 2D coordinates attached to atom0.

Parameters:
bond -
Throws:
CMLException - many, including invalid geometry operations

get3DBondStereo

public CMLBondStereo get3DBondStereo(CMLBond bond)
                              throws CMLException
get the bondstereo from 3D coordinates. gets atomRefs4 (at0, at1, at2, at3), then gets scalar product of at1-at0 X at1-lig2 and at1-at2 X at1-lig2 does NOT add bondStereo as child (in case further decisions need to be made)

Parameters:
bond -
Returns:
bondstereo (null if cannot calculate as CIS/TRANS)
Throws:
CMLException

calculate3DStereo

public java.lang.String calculate3DStereo(CMLBond bond,
                                          CMLAtom ligand0,
                                          CMLAtom ligand1)
                                   throws CMLException
calculates whether geometry of bond is cis or trans. requires geometry of form: ligand0-atom(0)-atom(1)-ligand1 i.e. ligand0 is a ligand of this,getAtom(0) and ligand1 is a ligand of this,getAtom(1) if connectivity is not as above throws CMLException if this.getAtom(0) or this.getAtom(1) have > 3 ligands throws CMLException if either end of bond is effectively linear return BondTool.LINEAR if torsion angle is in range pi/4 < t < 3*pi/4 return UNKNOWN

Parameters:
bond -
ligand0 - ligand(tool) for this.getAtom(0)
ligand1 - ligand(tool) for this.getAtom(1)
Returns:
CIS, TRANS, UNKNOWN,
Throws:
CMLException

add3DStereo

public void add3DStereo()
                 throws CMLException
uses 3D coordinates to add bondStereo.

Throws:
CMLException - inappropriate connectivity, coordinates, etc.

get2DLigandScalarProduct

public static double get2DLigandScalarProduct(CMLAtom atom0,
                                              CMLAtom atom1,
                                              CMLAtom ligand01,
                                              CMLAtom ligand02)
determines if 2D coordinates of atoms are suitable for bond stereochemistry. normally used for 2 atoms or bond and two ligands of one atom gets cross products of at0-at1 X at0-lig0 and at0-at1 X at0-lig1 and then gets their scalar product. If this is not negative, then the ligands are unsatisfactory for determining stereo

Parameters:
atom0 -
atom1 -
ligand01 -
ligand02 -
Returns:
scalar product or NaN

get3DLigandScalarProduct

public double get3DLigandScalarProduct(CMLAtom atom0,
                                       CMLAtom atom1,
                                       CMLAtom ligand01,
                                       CMLAtom ligand02)
determines if 3D coordinates of atoms are suitable for bond stereochemistry. normally used for 2 atoms or bond and two ligands of one atom gets cross products of at0-at1 X at0-lig0 and at0-at1 X at0-lig1 and then gets their scalar product. If this is not negative, then the ligands are unsatisfactory for determining stereo

Parameters:
atom0 -
atom1 -
ligand01 -
ligand02 -
Returns:
scalar product or NaN
